author: Mike Colias
title: GM Posts Loss on Tax Changes, Logs Strong Demand for Pickups and SUVs
text:
General Motors Co. said its fourth-quarter bottom line swung to a $5.2 billion loss because of a hefty charge related to U.S. tax-law changes, but stout demand for pickup trucks and SUVs pushed operating profit to a record for the quarter, surpassing Wall Street forecasts.
GM’s net loss for the final three months of 2017 included a $7.3 billion noncash write-down to reflect the loss in value of deferred tax assets held on its balance sheet. Several large companies have reported sizable write-downs in the value of those credits... RELATED VIDEO Winners and Losers of the GOP Tax Bill Christmas may be over but WSJ’s Richard Rubin keeps the holiday spirit alive by explaining who’s getting presents and who’s getting coal with the GOP tax bill.
